bestBHT.bht: Those who are unfaithful and unworthy of trust will experience a harsh punishment of being cut apart. This penalty underscores the seriousness of their unfaithfulness and the importance of fidelity. It's not just about lacking belief, but being unreliable and untrustworthy. The warning calls for constant readiness for the Lord’s coming, as it can occur at any moment.

Jamieson-Fausset-Brown: cut him in sunder—a punishment not unknown in the East; compare :-, 'sawn asunder' (1 Samuel 15:33; Daniel 2:5).
the unbelievers—the unfaithful, those unworthy of trust (Daniel 2:5- :), 'the hypocrites,' falsely calling themselves 'servants.'
Marvin Vincent: Unbelievers [απιστων] . Much better as Rev., the unfaithful; for it is of fidelity, not of faith, that Christ is speaking. Wyc., unfaithful men.
Archibald T. Robertson: Shall cut him asunder... An old and somewhat rare word... Used literally here."
With the unfaithful... Not here 'the unbelieving'... but the unreliable, the untrustworthy."
Once again we must either think that Jesus repeated the parable or that one of the writers has misplaced it.
John Gill: He will come in the very day which is appointed, though men know not of it, and do not look for it.
It becomes men to look for it every day and hour, lest it come upon them unawares.

These [unbelievers] are meant, not only the Heathens, who never heard of Christ; nor the Jews only, who disbelieved the Messiah, and rejected him when he came; but all deists and atheists, who deny revelation; even all unbelievers of, and scoffers at the coming of Christ.
John Wesley: The Lord will appoint him his portion — His everlasting portion, with the unfaithful - As faithful as he was once, God himself being the Judge!

bhtAttempts.bht: The verse is a warning about the consequences for those who are unfaithful or unworthy of trust. It describes a punishment of being cut apart, a severe consequence that highlights the seriousness of their unfaithfulness. This is not just about lack of faith, but about a lack of trustworthiness and fidelity. The punishment is specifically for the unfaithful, not just those who do not believe. It is a reminder to always be ready for the Lord's coming, as it can happen at any time.

This warning states that those who are unfaithful and unworthy of trust will face a severe punishment of being cut apart. It emphasizes the gravity of their unfaithfulness and the importance of fidelity. This punishment is not just for those who lack belief, but for those who are unreliable and untrustworthy. It serves as a reminder to always be prepared for the Lord's coming, as it can happen unexpectedly.

It's not just about lacking belief, but being unreliable and untrustworthy. The warning calls for constant readiness for the Lord’s coming, as it can occur at any moment.

Unfaithful individuals, those who falsely present themselves as servants, will face a punishment of being cut him in sunder. This highlights the severity of their untrustworthiness and lack of fidelity. It is not solely about their lack of faith, but their unreliability. This warning serves as a reminder to always be prepared for the Lord's coming, as it can happen unexpectedly.

Those who are unfaithful and unworthy of trust will experience a severe punishment. They will be cut him in sunder, emphasizing the gravity of their unfaithfulness. This punishment is not reserved solely for those who lack faith, but also for the unreliable and untrustworthy. It serves as a reminder to be prepared for the Lord's coming, as it may occur without warning.
